page.title: 11Opinions
page.content: By using questionnaires and personal interviews a cross-section of the local population gave opinions on life in Old Coulsdon in 1985.It was felt that this was a friendly neighbourhood,with local shops providing a homely service. Children felt,however that they were treated less well than adults when shopping, often being served after adults in spite of queue priority. Pavement parking was considered a dangerous nuisance by all age-groups, and the elderly thought the pavements ill-maintained. Children favoured the extension of the vehicle speed restriction,but adults disagreed. Police foot patrols around the streets, operating from a local station were considered a priority by all age-groups.The younger element pressed for a youth centre,and sports facilities.
